description.narrative: A More Equitable Society: Promoting Social Cohesion and Diversity in Bosnia and Herzegovina (Dialogue for the Future Phase II)

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

comment.narrative: 1. Funded at least 10 SGF initiatives in at least 10 different municipalities 2. At least 4 LDP meeting held 3. At least 20 MoUs 4. At least 10 assessments of common concerns and priorities completed 5. At least 1 Dialogue platform conference organized; 6. At least 1 women in leadership programme funded; 7. At least 1 local priority identified in the 28 DFF 2 municipalities funded.

1. A total of 11 SG has been implemented. The agreed small grants have gone beyond the number of municipalities envisaged within this Project goal. The selected grants and partners worked in over 50 municipalities all over Bosnia and Herzegovina. (December 2019) 2. 32 LDP meetings were held in 2019. Total of 969 persons participated in the platforms. 3. The MoUs with 28 municipalities have been signed in a form of letter exchange. The letters included naming of 28 local dialogue platform/municipal coordinators and endorsement of Project outputs. 4. Participants of the LDPs in 28 selected municipalities identified priorities and created action plans 5. Two dialogue platform conferences were held. First one in March 2019 and second one in December 2019. 6. Through implementation of the small grants two projects were funded which in their set objectives were directed at women as direct beneficiaries. The project targets aimed strengthening of women’s capacities in many different areas including leadership skills. 7. Municipalities did not fund any of the priorities defined in action plans in 2019. Several initiatives planned in the action plans, that didn’t needed funds for implementation have been conducted.
